briefTitle: Immunogenicity, Safety and Interchangeability of Two Tbe Vaccines Administered According to a Conventional Schedule in Children
officialTitle: SINGLE-BLIND, RANDOMIZED, PHASE III B STUDY IN CHILDREN AGED 1 - 11 YEARS TO INVESTIGATE THE IMMUNOGENICITY, SAFETY AND INTERCHANGEABILITY OF TWO TICK-BORNE ENCEPHALITIS (TBE) VACCINES ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO A CONVENTIONAL SCHEDULE
summary: The objective of this study is to assess the immunogenicity, safety and interchangeability of two different TBE vaccines in children aged 1-11 years, the first and second vaccination with either FSME-IMMUN 0.25ml Junior or Encepur 0.25ml Children and the third vaccination with FSME-IMMUN 0.25 ml Junior only, administered according to the conventional schedule (0, 28 and 360 days).

primaryOutcome.measure: Seropositivity Rate as Determined by Neutralization Test (NT) 28 Days After the Second Vaccination
